sentences.text: In July 2023, multiple wildfires started in Greece. They resulted in at least 28 deaths and injured 75 people, with over 80 wildfires being recorded. Seventy-nine people were arrested for arson.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=ertnews.gr |first=Συντακτική Ομάδα |date=2023-08-25 |title=Έβρος: Άλλος ένας μετανάστης νεκρός στις φλόγες κι ένας από παθολογικά αίτια – Μάχη με τις αναζωπυρώσεις |url=https://www.ertnews.gr/featured/evros-allos-enas-metanastis-nekros-stis-floges-ki-enas-apo-pathologika-aitia-maxi-me-tis-anazopyroseis/ |access-date=2023-08-29 |website=ertnews.gr |language=el}}</ref>

<ref name=BBCAug>{{cite news|access-date=25 August 2023|author1=Andre Rhoden-Paul|date=25 August 2023|language=en|location=Londres|quote=Greece has called out "arsonist scum" after police made 79 arson arrests over wildfires ravaging the country|title=Greece wildfires: 79 people arrested for arson|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-66612781|work=BBC}}<!-- auto-translated by Module:CS1 translator --></ref>

sentences.text: High temperatures reached {{convert|41.0|C|F}}, with highs anticipated to reach {{convert|45.0|C|F}} in Rhodes. Forecasters were suggesting that the heatwave engulfing Greece was set to be the longest in its history, lasting up to 16–17 days, surpassing the 1987 heatwave. It was also expected to be the hottest July recorded in more than 50 years.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Rhodes Wildfires: Situation expected to get worse in 45C heat, Authorities warn |url=https://news.sky.com/video/rhodes-wildfires-situation-expected-to-get-worse-in-45c-heat-authorities-warn-12925874 |access-date=23 July 2023 |website=Sky News |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |agency=Agence France-Presse |date=22 July 2023 |title=Greece faces hottest July weekend in 50 years, forecaster says, as scores of wildfires rage |language=en-GB |work=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/22/greece-faces-hottest-july-weekend-in-50-years-forecaster-says-as-scores-of-wildfires-rage |access-date=23 July 2023 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref>

sentences.text: Following a series of heatwaves and wildfires taking place over Europe, wildfires in Greece started on 17 July 2023. The Greek government established a Crisis Management Unit to respond to the situation. A wildfire that started on the Greek island of Rhodes on 18 July led to the emergency evacuation|evacuation of four locations, including two seaside resorts. Approximately 2,000 people, including tourists, were safely evacuated by sea, accounting for less than 10% of the island's tourist accommodations, according to the Fire Corps spokesman. On 22 August, eighteen bodies were found in a forested area of northern Greece; initial reports suggested those who died may have been migrants. Additionally, as days passed with more land being burned and property being destroyed more and more, civilians started complaining about the lack of strength in Greece's firefighting capabilities—something that they attribute to government mismanagement.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Nellas |first=Demetris |date=22 July 2023 |title=Greek wildfires: Thousands of tourists evacuated as wildfire rages on island of Rhodes |language=en |work=Nzherald |url=https://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/greek-wildfires-thousands-of-tourists-evacuated-as-a-wildfire-rages-on-the-greek-island-of-rhodes/UC4DANXBVNCG7CZXFSBK2M3ORU/ |access-date=24 July 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-08-22 |title=Greece wildfires: Eighteen bodies found in Greek forest |language=en-GB |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-66579193 |access-date=2023-08-22}}</ref>

sentences.text: According to a senior climate crisis official, 667 fires were caused by a "human hand", blaming either negligence or arson. 79 arrests were made as of late August.<ref name=BBCAug />

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/28/greece-fires-arsonists-extreme-weather|title=Most fires in Greece were started 'by human hand', government says|work=The Guardian|date=28 July 2023|access-date=3 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: By 25 August, officials had arrested 163 people on fire-related charges since the start of the fire prevention season, including 118 for negligence and 24 for deliberate arson, and the police had made a further 18 arrests according to government spokesperson Pavlos Marinakis.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Hundreds of firefighters battle raging Greek wildfires |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/aug/27/hundreds-of-firefighters-battle-raging-greek-wildfires |access-date=28 August 2023 |work=The Guardian |agency=Associated Press in Athens |publisher=Guardian News & Media |date=27 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: Intense winds exacerbated Greece's wildfires, sparking over 50 new blazes amid hot, dry weather; casualties include two deaths and two injured firefighters on August 21, 2023.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last= Smith |first= Maxine |date=2023-08-16 |title= FirstFT: US presses Iran to stop selling drones to Russia |language=en |work=Financial Times |url= https://www.ft.com/content/fa140f55-d02c-4c64-8176-b5530599e836  |access-date=2023-08-23}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 23 July, mass evacuations were ordered in Corfu following major wildfire breakouts on the island.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Corfu latest Greek island to evacuate over wildfires |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-66286099 |access-date=24 July 2023 |agency=bbc.com |publisher=bbc.com |date=23 July 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: In Karystos, the flames reached a height of {{convert|20|m}} and the mayor asked for increased use of aerial vehicles in extinguishing operations. A man was reported to have died from heat stroke as a result of the wildfires on the island of Euboea|Evia. On 25 July 2023, a Canadair CL-215 crashed in Karystos, killing its two pilots, with a similar incident that happened almost 15 years to the day in the same area with the same casualties. Later the same day, a 41-year-old shepherd was found charred in an inaccessible area outside the village of Platanistos in Karystos.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Gecsoyler |first=Sammy |date=22 July 2023 |title=Heatwave set to be Greece's longest as extreme weather continues in Europe |language=en-GB |work=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/22/heatwave-set-to-be-greeces-longest-as-extreme-weather-continues-in-europe |access-date=23 July 2023 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web|url=https://metro.co.uk/2023/07/25/greece-wildfires-plane-crash-evia-19188820/?ico=metro-posts_article_whats-trending-now|title=Plane crashes and bursts into flames fighting wildfires on Greek island|publisher=Metro News|last=Robertson|first=Kirsten|date=25 July 2023|access-date=25 July 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web|url=https://metro.co.uk/2023/07/25/plane-crash-greece-today-canadair-karystos-19189556/?ico=just-in_home_just-in|title=Almost 15 years to the day, a small Greek island is rocked by identical plane crashes|publisher=Metro News|date=July 25, 2023|access-date=July 27, 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.protothema.gr/greece/article/1396111/nekros-se-dusvati-periohi-vrethike-o-ktinotrofos-stin-karusto/|title=Νεκρός σε δύσβατη περιοχή βρέθηκε ο κτηνοτρόφος στην Κάρυστο|date=25 July 2023 |language=Greek|publisher=Πρώτο Θέμα|access-date=25 July 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text:
Two major wildfires broke out in the area of Magnesia (regional unit)|Magnesia on 26 July, in Almyros and near Velestino. The fires managed to reach Nea Anchialos National Airport|Nea Anchialos Air Base and the Industrial Zone of Volos. Many General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon|F-16s were ordered to move from Nea Anchialos National Airport|Nea Anchialos Air Base to Larissa National Airport|Larissa Air Base for safety reasons.
The wildfire reached an ammunition warehouse and several explosions occurred, triggering the evacuation of the Nea Anchialos town.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Νέα Αγχίαλος: Εικόνα διάλυσης – Από τις βάρκες του 112, στις εκρήξεις της 111 Πτέρυγας Μάχης |url=https://www.news247.gr/koinonia/nea-agchialos-eikona-dialysis-apo-tis-varkes-toy-112-stis-ekrixeis-tis-111-pterygas-machis.10128151.html |access-date=28 July 2023|date=28 July 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: The island of Rhodes suffered multiple wildfires, which resulted in over an estimated 19,000 people being evacuated by land and sea. Emergency alerts were sent to residents on the island to warn them of the wildfires and to evacuate.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Greece carries out its biggest ever evacuation as wildfires rage on Rhodes |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/23/high-winds-expected-to-impede-fight-wildfires-in-rhodes |work=The Guardian|first1=Helena|last1=Smith|first2=Angelique|last2=Chrisafis |date=23 July 2023|access-date=22 August 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=La Grecia brucia, migliaia di persone in fuga dal Paese |url=https://www.ansa.it/sito/photogallery/primopiano/2023/07/24/la-grecia-brucia-migliaia-di-persone-evacuate_b7700c86-09d9-44e4-a93e-9fd8b8a0698b.html |access-date=24 July 2023 |agency=ansa.it |publisher=ansa.it |date=24 July 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: The fire department in Rhodes stated the fires there prompted the "largest evacuation operation" ever on the island, with the fire department using 10 firefighting airplanes, eight firefighting helicopters, over 260 firefighters, 49 fire trucks and hundreds of volunteers, among others, to tackle the blaze on the island.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Largest evacuation operation ever on Rhodes says fire department |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/world-66282605 |access-date=23 July 2023 |website=BBC News |date=23 July 2023 |language=en-gb}}</ref>

sentences.text: Authorities declared a state of emergency on 20 July 2023 in three municipalities of Rhodes, including Lindos, which is home to many tourist villages.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ekathimerini.com/news/1215874/state-of-emergency-declared-in-three-areas-in-rhodes-as-wildfire-rages|title=State of emergency declared in three areas in Rhodes as wildfire rages|date=July 20, 2023|work=Kathimerini}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 23 July 2023, it was announced that 1,200 extra people would be evacuated from the villages of Pefki, Lindos, and Kalathos. Flights to Rhodes from British package holiday company Jet2.com were cancelled until 30 July 2023 and from TUI Airways|TUI until 26 July 2023.<ref name=BBCRhodes/>

references.text: <ref name=BBCRhodes>{{Cite news |date=23 July 2023 |title=Rhodes fires: Jet2 and TUI flights cancelled as British tourists in limbo |language=en-GB |work=BBC News|first=Charley|last=Adams |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-66282387 |access-date=23 July 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 2 August, the Ministry of Tourism (Greece)|Ministry of Tourism lifted the state of emergency on Rhodes and offered complimentary travel accommodations to tourists who were evacuated from the island in the previous month.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news|title=Greece offers free vacations to tourists evacuated from Rhodes wildfires |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/rebeccahughes/2023/08/04/greece-offers-free-vacations-to-tourists-evacuated-from-rhodes-wildfires/ |newspaper=Forbes|first=Rebecca Ann|last=Hughes |date=4 August 2023|access-date=22 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: A major fire started near the city of Alexandroupolis in eastern Western Thrace on August 21. The fire was stated to be "the largest recorded in the EU" up to this time by EU officials, with around 73.000 hectares (730 square kilometers) burnt. Most of the burnt area is concentrated in the Dadia Forest. Several migrants died when they got trapped by the flames near the Dadia Forest. As of the 28th of August the vast majority of the Dadia forest as well as the surrounding pine forests have been destroyed with more than 80,000 hectares (198,000 acres) scorched. On the island of Samothraki a power outage occurred because of the Alexandroupolis fire. The general hospital of Alexandroupolis had to evacuate its patients. The fire had almost reached the hospital.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-08-24 |title=Firefighters in Greece struggle to control wildfires, including the EU's largest blaze |url=https://apnews.com/article/wildfires-greece-europe-firefighters-tenerife-turkey-c8c1d0ae0087f62293557efa599cfe65 |access-date=2023-08-26 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite magazine |date=2023-08-24 |title=Firefighters in Greece Are Struggling to Battle The E.U.'s Biggest Wildfire Ever Recorded |url=https://time.com/6307987/greece-firefighters-battle-biggest-eu-wildfire-ever-recorded/ |access-date=2023-08-26 |magazine=Time |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=August 29, 2023 |title=Πυρκαγιά στον Εβρο: Νέα δορυφορική εικόνα της καταστροφής – Πάνω από 808.000 τα καμένα στρέμματα |work=Kathimerini |url=https://www.kathimerini.gr/society/562587796/pyrkagia-ston-evro-nea-doryforiki-eikona-tis-katastrofis-sta-808-000-ta-kamena-stremmata/ |access-date=August 29, 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: The European Union announced that more than 450 firefighters and seven airplanes would be deployed to help the situation in Greece, with 81 firefighters, 26 vehicles, and three planes specifically helping the situation in Rhodes.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Over 450 firefighters and 7 airplanes from 🇪🇺 have been operating in #Greece as fires sprout across the country. |url=https://twitter.com/JanezLenarcic/status/1683057095229292544?s=20 |access-date=23 July 2023 |website=Twitter |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 23 July, in response to the wildfires in Rhodes, the UK Government announced that they would deploy a Rapid Deployment Team consisting of responders to support British nationals on the island, being based at Rhodes International Airport.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=BREAKING: British Government have sent a Rapid Deployment Team to Rhodes |url=https://twitter.com/SkyNews/status/1683158106077814785?s=20 |access-date=23 July 2023 |website=Twitter |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Three firefighting helicopters were deployed from Egypt.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=I want to express our gratitude to Egypt for sending 3 firefighting helicopters |url=https://twitter.com/primeministergr/status/1683087870930694144?s=46&t=ov-fn5FDvGppg0zgQQa7AA |access-date=24 July 2023 |website=Twitter |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Two firefighting planes were sent by France.

sentences.text: Jordan sent four firefighting helicopters to Greece.

sentences.text: Malta sent 20 firefighters to Greece. This was the first time that Malta had sent firefighters abroad.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Our gratitude goes out to Malta, for sending 20 firefighters to Greece and reinforcing our efforts on the ground |url=https://twitter.com/primeministergr/status/1682392025260490752?s=46&t=ov-fn5FDvGppg0zgQQa7AA |access-date=24 July 2023 |website=Twitter |language=en}}</ref>
